raw_text:
Iranian misses Israel match
 
 Iranian striker Vahid Hashemian will not travel to Israel for Bayern Munich's Champions League match against Maccabi Tel Aviv on Wednesday.
 
 The German club said the player had pulled out because of a back injury. Iran refuses to recognise Israel's right to exist and does not allow its citizens to travel to the country. A Bayern spokesman said on Monday that the decision not to take Hashemian to Israel had been motivated only by his physical condition. "He's got back pain and he couldn't train," the spokesman said. "It would have made no sense for him to go." Iran gave judo world champion Arash Miresmaeili a $125,000 reward when he refused to fight an Israeli at the Athens Olympics. The International Judo Federation considered taking action against Miresmaeili but concluded he had been overweight for the fight and could not have taken part.
llama3.2:1b: Iranian striker Vahid Hashemian will miss Bayern Munich's Champions League match against Maccabi Tel Aviv due to a back injury, which he suffered from pulling out of Iran's national team match in Israel because of his physical condition.
llama3.2:3b: Iranian striker Vahid Hashemian will not travel to Israel for Bayern Munich's Champions League match due to a back injury, amid Iran's refusal to recognize Israel's right to exist.

Iran refuses to recognize Israel's right to exist and its citizens are forbidden from traveling there, although Bayern Munich has stated his absence was only related to physical limitations. Iran rewarded judo champion Arash Miresmaeili for refusing to fight an Israeli at the Olympics as well.

The main points are: Vahid Hashemian is being considered for a match against Maccabi Tel Aviv. He's from Iran, which doesn't recognize Israel, so he can't travel there. Iranian striker Vahid Hashemian is being considered for a match against Maccabi Tel Aviv. He will not attend due to back pain and lack of training ability. Iran refuses recognition of its citizens' existence, and Arash Miresmaeili received $125,000 reward, but later found overweight in an Olympic fight, prompting the International Judo Federation's consideration but conclusion that he couldn't participate.

Iran does not recognise Israel's right to exist and does not allow its citizens to travel to the country, resulting in the decision by Iranian player Vaheh Hashemia to pull out of the match. The move was motivated only by Hashemia's physical condition, with the team citing his back pain as a reason for declining to go. The International Judo Federation ultimately decided not to take action against Arash Miresmaeili for failing to make weight and could not participate in the fight.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Iranian footballer Vahid Hashemian, a Bayern Munich player, will not participate in their Champions League match against Maccabi Tel Aviv in Israel on Wednesday due to a back injury. This decision is unrelated to Iran's stance on Israel's right to exist, which prevents its citizens from traveling there. Bayern Munich cited Hashemian's inability to train as the reason for his absence. The International Judo Federation did not pursue disciplinary action against Miresmaeili.
